title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 18)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: A one-family Colonial home at 32 W Cedar St., Boston, sold for $4,800,000, the highest in the report.
In Acton, a town house at 405 Great Elm Way sold for $502,500, featuring 1,700 square feet with 3 bedrooms.
A two-family duplex at 2 Elmwood St., Amesbury, built in 1880, sold for $850,000 on a 13,300-square-foot lot.

title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B suggests split from Patriots' Stefon Diggs during her concert in Los Angeles.
Diggs and Cardi B faced breakup rumors after unfollowing each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl.
Stefon Diggs is facing battery and strangulation charges with a pre-trial hearing set for April 1.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A Massachusetts judge ruled UMass Amherst violated a student's First Amendment rights by suspending him over a protest.
Junior Kivlighan de Montebello protested RTX's presence at a career fair, alleging UMass punished constitutionally protected speech.
The court mandated UMass to lift Montebello's suspension and prohibited further sanctions during the ongoing case.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes, 36, charged with motor vehicle homicide in Brockton hit-and-run.
Victim Alfredo Alves, 23, died after being hit by Hayes' SUV after night at strip club.
Hayes failed to post $15,000 bail, placed on leave; court date set for March 31.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: Foggy headlights lose their protective coating over time, blocking up to 90% of light if not maintained.
Turtle Wax headlight pads showed short-term improvement, but Meguiar's Keep Clear Coating was effective for up to one year.
AAA members can test and replace car batteries at home, with the service offering a three-year warranty for $220.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway on charges related to child rape and human trafficking.
Garcia faces multiple charges, including trafficking for sexual servitude, child nudity, and dissemination of explicit material.
Boston Municipal Court released Garcia on $5,000 bail with conditions regarding contact with children and the alleged victim.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, arrested for alleged motor vehicle homicide in the Pittsfield hit-and-run that killed 69-year-old William Colbert.
Victim William Colbert was found dead near Best Western Hotel, four miles from the crash site at Linden Street/Francis Avenue.
Gross faces charges of motor vehicle homicide and leaving a crash scene; arraignment set for Wednesday in Central Berkshire District Court.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Hereâ€™s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: The Massachusetts RMV is holding a lottery for special 250th anniversary license plates commemorating the state's role in U.S. independence.
Residents can apply online from February 16 to April 17, 2026, with no entry fee required.
A total of 1,000 plates are available, and winners will be announced within five days of the early May lottery.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts becomes the first state to use AI in its executive branch, implementing ChatGPT across nearly 40,000 state employees.
The AI assistant will be implemented in phases, starting with the Executive Office of Technology Services and Security.
The National Association of Government Employees expresses concern, fearing AI could replace significant job duties and questioning security.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles is closing its Gardner, Massachusetts facilities, resulting in 91 job losses by the end of September.
Garlock Flexibles' Gardner locations at 164 Fredette St. and 77 Industrial Rowe are shutting down, affecting nearly 100 employees.
Owned by Astara Capital Partners since 2021, Garlock Flexibles rebranded in 2023 and offers packaging solutions for the food industry.
